instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight after minor liquid damage
threads.message:
Looking for a little help tracking down a no backlight issue on a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Macbook Pro with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board.  The machine chimes and is booting up and displaying a picture as seen by putting a flashlight behind the apple logo.

Any help on what specifically to start looking at to trace this down would be much appreciated.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight after minor liquid damage
threads.message: what voltage do you get on pin1 of j8300

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight after minor liquid damage
threads.message: This is absolutely nuts but it reads 51.5v once the laptop is turned on and chimes

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight after minor liquid damage
threads.message: It's not detecting a load, try a known good screen or check lvds cable/connector

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight after minor liquid damage
threads.message: Burned cable or connector. Could also be fried on the LCD side so you don't see if.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight after minor liquid damage
threads.message: Just wanted to follow up with this.  It turns out that the backlight was blown on the LCD side of things.  Replaced and now working normally.
